description:
An open-source alternative to Claude Cowork, powered by OpenCode

OpenWork is an extensible, open-source “Claude Work” style system for knowledge workers.
It’s a native desktop app that runs OpenCode under the hood, but presents it as a clean, guided workflow:
- pick a workspace
- start a run
- watch progress + plan updates
- approve permissions when needed
- reuse what works (templates + skills)
The goal: make “agentic work” feel like a product, not a terminal.
Highlights
- Externalize owpenbot integration and fetch the sidecar from GitHub releases.
- Verify owpenbot Telegram tokens on save.
Fixes
- Simplify the responding indicator for a cleaner status display.
- Wire reload toasts through the OpenWork server.
- Harden owpenbot sidecar handling with checksum verification, Windows x64 fallback, and monorepo path/build fixes.
Chores
- Update the AUR PKGBUILD for 0.9.3.
